title: API Authentication and Security Best Practices
description: A comprehensive guide to securely authenticating and managing API access for Nomic Atlas.

overview.purpose: To ensure secure and efficient use of the Nomic Atlas API by following recommended authentication and security practices.
use_cases: Managing API keys securely for multiple users or applications.
Preventing unauthorized access to sensitive data.
Implementing secure API access in automated workflows.

authentication_methods.description: Nomic Atlas uses API keys for authenticating requests. These keys must be included in the request headers.

example_request.python_code:
import requests

url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/maps'
headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer <API_KEY>'
}
response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

security_best_practices.description: Do not expose API keys in public repositories, client-side code, or shared documents.
recommendations: Store API keys in environment variables or secure vaults.
Restrict access to API keys to authorized personnel only.

security_best_practices.practice: Use HTTPS for All API Requests
security_best_practices.description: Ensure all API requests are made over HTTPS to encrypt data in transit.
recommendations: Verify that the API endpoint starts with 'https://'.

security_best_practices.description: Periodically generate new API keys to reduce the risk of unauthorized access.
recommendations: Set reminders to rotate keys every 30-90 days.
Update all workflows and applications with the new keys.

security_best_practices.description: Limit the scope of API keys to the minimum permissions required for the application.
recommendations: Use read-only keys for data retrieval.
Create separate keys for different applications or users.

security_best_practices.description: Track API usage to identify unusual activity or potential security breaches.
recommendations: Enable usage logs and alerts for suspicious activity.

security_best_practices.description: If an API key is suspected to be compromised, revoke it immediately and generate a new one.
recommendations: Notify affected stakeholders about the key rotation.
Update all systems with the new key promptly.

steps.title: Generate an API Key
steps.description: Log in to the Nomic Atlas dashboard and generate an API key under the 'API Keys' section.
steps.example_ui_path: Dashboard > Settings > API Keys > Generate Key

steps.title: Store the API Key Securely
steps.description: Save the API key in a secure location, such as an environment variable or a secrets manager.

steps.title: Use the API Key in Requests
steps.description: Include the API key in the 'Authorization' header for all API requests.

example_request.python_code:
import requests

url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/maps'
headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Bearer <API_KEY>'
}
response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

steps.title: Monitor and Rotate API Keys
steps.description: Regularly review API key usage and rotate keys as needed to maintain security.

python_script.description: Securely authenticate and make API requests using environment variables.
python_script.code:
import os
import requests

# Step 1: Retrieve API key from environment variable
api_key = os.getenv('NOMIC_API_KEY')

# Step 2: Make an authenticated API request
url = 'https://api-atlas.nomic.ai/v1/maps'
headers = {
    'Authorization': f'Bearer {api_key}'
}
response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

notes: API keys should only be shared with trusted applications and personnel.
Consider using IP whitelisting to restrict API access to specific IP addresses.
Enable logging and alerts for API activity to detect and respond to potential security issues quickly.
